egi.definition: The digital certificate that combines aesthetic value, immutable blockchain traceability, and environmental contribution through EPP. Each EGI is unique, verifiable on-chain, and linked to a physical or digital asset.

fiat.definition: Traditional legal tender currency issued by a state (euro, dollar, etc.). FlorenceEGI operates primarily in FIAT to ensure regulatory compliance.

mint.definition: The operation of creating a new digital asset on the blockchain. When you 'mint' an EGI, it is registered for the first time on the Algorand network.

transfer.definition: Operation to transfer a digital asset from one wallet to another on the blockchain. Every transfer is tracked and publicly verifiable.

anchor-hash.definition: Cryptographic hash that anchors EGI data to the blockchain, ensuring integrity and immutability of certified information.

payout.definition: Transfer of funds from PSP to merchant or creator after a sale. Payout occurs in FIAT to the indicated bank account.

royalties.definition: Percentage fees due to the creator on each resale of the work. On FlorenceEGI they are automatic (4.5%) and managed via smart contract.

stablecoin.definition: Cryptocurrency whose value is pegged to a FIAT currency (e.g., USDC, USDT). FlorenceEGI can only accept them through MiCA-authorized partner PSPs.

custodial.definition: Mode in which the platform manages the wallet's private keys on behalf of the user. Simpler but with less direct control.

algo.definition: The native cryptocurrency of the Algorand blockchain. Used to pay transaction fees and as minimum balance requirement for wallets.

partner-autorizzato.definition: External provider with CASP/EMI license that can handle cryptocurrency payments on behalf of merchants, keeping FlorenceEGI MiCA-safe.

settlement.definition: The final settlement process of a financial transaction. The moment when funds are actually transferred between parties.

emi.definition: Authorized Electronic Money Institution to issue and manage electronic money. EMI partners can manage MiCA-compliant stablecoins.

opt-out.definition: Algorand operation that removes an asset from the wallet, freeing up the minimum locked balance (0.1 ALGO per asset).

mnemonic.definition: Sequence of 25 words representing the wallet's private key. Allows complete access recovery. Never share it.

dashboard.definition: Personal control panel where users manage their EGIs, view statistics, initiate operations, and monitor transactions.

epp.definition: Verified environmental projects natively integrated. Each transaction automatically allocates a portion to these projects for carbon offsetting or reforestation.

ammk.definition: Term coined by FlorenceEGI to describe platforms that transform works or content into EGI (digital assets) and govern their entire value cycle. FlorenceEGI is the world's first AMMk.

florenceegi.definition: Digital certification platform that unites art, blockchain technology, and environmental sustainability. Enables authenticity certification, ownership tracking, and asset valorization.

coa.definition: Verified and immutable authenticity certificate linked to each EGI. Includes provenance, technique, materials, condition, and work history.

egizzare.definition: The act of transforming a physical or digital asset into a certified EGI on the blockchain. The motto: 'If it exists, EGIfy it. If you EGIfy it, it has value'.

algorand.definition: Sustainable and carbon-negative blockchain based on Proof-of-Stake. Used by FlorenceEGI for its energy efficiency and transaction speed.

blockchain.definition: Distributed, immutable, and transparent digital ledger that guarantees EGI authenticity. Every transaction is publicly verifiable.

nft.definition: Non-fungible token representing a unique asset on the blockchain. EGIs are NFTs on Algorand but with legal and documentary value.

asa.definition: Standard for creating tokens on Algorand. EGIs are minted as ASAs with complete and verifiable metadata.

minting.definition: The act of creating a new EGI on the blockchain, registering it for the first time. Irreversible process that generates the certified digital asset.

smart-contract.definition: Self-executing intelligent contract on the blockchain. Automatically manages royalties, payment distribution, and ownership transfers.

hash.definition: Unique sequence generated by algorithm that guarantees file or document integrity. The digital fingerprint that uniquely identifies each EGI.

ipfs.definition: InterPlanetary File System - decentralized storage system where EGI metadata and images are permanently archived.

proof-of-stake.definition: Blockchain consensus mechanism used by Algorand, much more efficient and sustainable than Bitcoin's Proof-of-Work.

carbon-negative.definition: Technology that absorbs more CO2 than it produces. Algorand is carbon-negative, making FlorenceEGI sustainable by definition.

wallet.definition: Digital wallet containing your EGIs and tokens. Can be custodial (platform-managed) or non-custodial (full control).

seed-phrase.definition: Sequence of 25 words allowing wallet access recovery. NEVER share it with anyone, not even support.

creator.definition: The original author of the work. Receives primary sales proceeds and automatic royalties on resales (4.5% + potential Resale Right). Always retains Moral and Economic Rights.

co-creatore.definition: Someone who contributes to the creation of a work through minting. Becomes an indelible part of the EGI's identity, permanently recorded in metadata.

collector.definition: The guardian of value who preserves the work, acquiring and conserving EGI. Can be private, institutional, or corporate.

mecenate.definition: Someone who supports an artist or collection, becoming an activator of cultural value with a verified profile. Modern evolution of artistic patronage.

curatore.definition: Professional who selects and enhances works. FlorenceEGI enables a career as a digital curator with specific tools.

diritti-morali.definition: Inalienable and perpetual rights (L. 633/1941 Art. 20): paternity (author recognition) and integrity (no modifications). The Creator ALWAYS retains them.

diritti-patrimoniali.definition: Economic rights (L. 633/1941 Art. 12-19): reproduction, public communication, distribution. The Work Owner does NOT acquire copyright.

diritto-seguito.definition: Legal right (L. 633/1941 Art. 19bis) of the Creator: 4%-0.25% on resales ≥€3,000 through professionals. Managed by SIAE. Cumulative with platform royalty.

royalty-piattaforma.definition: Percentage (4.5%) guaranteed to the Creator on every resale, even under €3,000. Automatic via smart contract, separate from legal Resale Right.

gdpr.definition: European General Data Protection Regulation. FlorenceEGI is GDPR-by-design through ULM, AuditLogService, and ConsentService.

mica.definition: European regulation on crypto-asset markets. FlorenceEGI is MiCA-safe because it doesn't manage crypto funds for third parties.

egili.definition: FlorenceEGI's utility token. Used to unlock premium features, pay for AI services, and access advanced functionalities.

equilibrium.definition: Token that powers the reward system, ranking, and ethical interactions. Egili are micro-units of Equilibrium.

psp.definition: Authorized payment service provider (e.g., Stripe, Adyen). Handles FIAT payments ensuring regulatory compliance.

natan.definition: FlorenceEGI's AI assistant dedicated to document assistance, notarization, RAG services, and AI automations. Powers the NATAN Market Engine (Valuation + Activation).

art-advisor.definition: AI module providing suggestions on descriptions, pricing, SEO keywords, and work valorization strategies.

governance-duale.definition: Structure based on FlorenceEGI SRL (operational engine) and Associazione Frangette APS (guardian of values). Balance between profit and mission.

florenceegi-core.definition: Central node of the ecosystem: onboarding, authentication, billing, ULM/UEM, audit, tenant registry, and shared policies.

tenant-specializzato.definition: Vertical instance connected to the core with dedicated services: e.g., Natan (AI, notarization, RAG) and FlorenceArtEGI (art and marketplace).

rbac.definition: Role-based access control system. FlorenceEGI has global roles (account) and local roles (collection: Owner, Admin, Editor, Viewer).

ulm.definition: Event logging system ensuring complete auditability and GDPR compliance. Tracks every action on the platform.

audit-trail.definition: Complete and immutable chronological record of all operations for verification and traceability.

event-bus.definition: System receiving on-chain and off-chain triggers and activating NATAN actions: campaigns, notifications, price suggestions.

qr-nfc.definition: Unidirectional technologies linking the physical asset to the digital certificate for immediate public verification.

drops.definition: Quarterly events selecting excellent works and culminating in a Memorable Evening, concentrating attention, incentives, and liquidity.

serata-memorabile.definition: Final event of each quarterly Drop. Celebrates Creators and showcases the most significant works with exhibition, liquidity, and prizes.

collezione.definition: Grouping of EGIs under a theme or author. Each collection has autonomous management with specific roles (Owner, Admin, Editor, Viewer).

traits.definition: Specific characteristics of an EGI: materials, technique, dimensions, style. Locked on IPFS after minting.

oracode.definition: Paradigm merging engineering and symbolism. The grammar of FlorenceEGI's technological truth.

casp.definition: Crypto-Asset Service Provider. Entity offering exchange, custody, or cryptocurrency transfer services. FlorenceEGI is NOT a CASP.
